data.name: ResourceFlowDirection
data.comment: Controls the FlowDirection for all elements in the RootFrame. Set to the traditional direction of this resource file's language

data.name: ResourceLanguage
data.comment: Controls the Language and ensures that the font for all elements in the RootFrame aligns with the app's language. Set to the language code of this resource file's language.

data.name: BluetoothIsNotAllowed
data.value: Obd is not allowed to use

data.name: DeviceNotFound
data.value: Device not found, tap to refresh

data.name: MoreDevices
data.value: More obd devices, tap to select one

data.name: ObdBuy
data.value: What is OBD and where it buy?

data.name: OutOfRangeOfDevice
data.value: Device out of range, tap to refresh

data.name: TurnOnBluetooth
data.value: Turn on your bluetooth by tap here

data.name: ObdDescription
data.value: On-board diagnostics (OBD) is an automotive term referring to a vehicle's self-diagnostic and reporting capability. OBD systems give the vehicle owner or repair technician access to the status of the various vehicle sub-systems. The amount of diagnostic information available via OBD has varied widely since its introduction in the early 1980s' versions of on-board vehicle computers. Early versions of OBD would simply illuminate a malfunction indicator light or "idiot light" if a problem was detected but would not provide any information as to the nature of the problem. Modern OBD implementations use a standardized digital communications port to provide real-time data in addition to a standardized series of diagnostic trouble codes, or DTCs, which allow one to rapidly identify and remedy malfunctions within the vehicle.

data.name: GpsNotAccurred
data.value: Waiting for quality signal from the GPS receiver. Without this, it is not possible to start measuring of circuit.

data.name: AppEndDescription
data.value: To close an applicationpress the back button again. The recording will be terminated.

data.name: StartDescription
data.value: The application now waiting for the launch. When you move, application is automatically starts to count time. You can cancel action now or anytime during the ride.

data.name: SpeedDescription
data.value: Stop the car, start the measurement is possible only if you stand on the spot. Your current speed is:

data.name: ErrorDescription
data.value: Sorry, but the application has encountered an unexpected error. Please help me improve the application and send me an email with an error message after next start. The application will be closed now.

data.name: NoLap_Description
data.value: You have not finished any round. It is not possible to attempt to save this record. Get off at least one first round and then stop recording.

data.name: WrongLap_Description
data.value: You have moved away from the original path. The recording was automatically ended and this round has not been counted.

data.name: ReportDescription
data.value: Last termination of application caused by error. Want to help me improve an application and report a bug?

data.name: BackupApplyDescription
data.value: Do you really wan to load backup from cloud storage? This action is not reversable!

data.name: Backup_NotSignedIn_Description
data.value: You are not logged into any cloud storage service. For proper operation of backups you need to login.

data.name: DownloadBackupHelp
data.value: Click here to download bacup from your storage

data.name: BackupNotFoundDescription
data.value: Backup file not found on server.

data.name: SendByEmailBody
data.value: There is link for download your backuped data.{E}Your backup id is {0}{E}Click on {1} to start download.

data.name: Tutorial_End_Description
data.value: Can i have close the tutorial? You can rerun this tutorial from more menu.

data.name: Tutorial_BackupFileMenu_Description
data.value: There are four important buttons in the menu. 1) Use this button to back up the main file 2) If the backup is created, you can refer to it in the browser (and store) or 3) let it send the email. If you have a backup on cloud storage 4) you can download it by click on this button.

data.name: Tutorial_Backup_Description
data.value: After clicking on the "Backup" in the settings page, you will see information about the backup. Here you will find the date of the last backup, the backup identifier and settings. 1) Whether you want to do a backup after starting the application and 2) when you want to backup your data, you must login into cloud storage.

data.name: Tutorial_Information
data.value: Please take a few minutes to this tutorial.

data.name: Tutorial_LapsMenu_Description
data.value: Here is a list of all circuits 1). There are only unique to each round and is shown best time. Names of circuits are generated automatically by the length and location. The program automatically detects the same circuits, so you can try to ride over and over again.

data.name: Tutorial_MainScreen_Description_One
data.value: On the main screen you can see a map of your current location, where you are. Here you will find information about the status of GPS signal and if you move, you will see information about your speed. Start button can be used only if the car is not moving and the GPS signal quality is good.

data.name: Tutorial_MainScreen_Description_Two
data.value: The main menu contains four main buttons. 1) Times, 2) Laps, 3) Share and 4) Settings and others.

data.name: Tutorial_Measurement_Description
data.value: After pressing the start button, the application will wait for a car move. Once set in motion, it automatically starts measuring and displaying the track. The application is currently inactive and the only option is stop measurement by pressing stop button. If you do not do even one lap, time is not counted.

data.name: Tutorial_MoreMenu_Description
data.value: If you click on the other menu (three dots), there appears a list of other settings in front of you. 1) Used to enable GPS, 2) Connect the OBD module if there are more, you can select one, 3) Is used for uploading or sending backup. In this menu are also buttons to set the units, links to social networks and more.

data.name: Tutorial_ThanksEnd_Description
data.value: The tutorial is over and you can always run the tutorial again from application menu.

data.name: Tutorial_ThankYou
data.value: Thank you for installing CoPilot SpeedWay.

data.name: Tutorial_TimesMenu_Description
data.value: In this menu is situated, like on the home screen, 1) start button. After a successful lap record there will be displayed all records 2) with number of round, the best time and average speed.

data.name: Tutorial_WhatIsIt_Description
data.value: CoPilot Speedway is an application that is used to measure the time circuits and displaying statistics. Applications can detect the same rounds, automatically check if you cross start and record the fastest times. And do not even have to start from the same place. The application also cooperates with CoPilot.

data.name: Tutorial_Warning
data.value: WARNING: This application is used to measure the speed on the rail for this purpose. Do not use this application in the normal traffic!
